intro: Sebastiania daphnoides var. intermedia, commonly known as the silverleaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that have a silvery-white underside, giving it a striking appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by orange or red berries. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
